bytebase.store.BoundingBox.schema.strict.description: BoundingBox defines the bounding box for spatial indexes.
bytebase.store.BoundingBox.schema.strict.title: Bounding Box

expression.description: The expression is the expression of a check constraint.

name.description: The name of the check constraint.

bytebase.store.DimensionalConfig.schema..description: DimensionalConfig defines dimensional and constraint parameters for spatial indexes.

data_type.description:
Spatial data type
 Examples: GEOMETRY, GEOGRAPHY, POINT, POLYGON, etc.

layer_gtype.description:
Oracle geometry type constraint
 Examples: POINT, LINE, POLYGON, COLLECTION

operator_class.description:
PostgreSQL operator class
 Examples: gist_geometry_ops_2d, gist_geometry_ops_nd, etc.

bytebase.store.DimensionalConfig.schema..title: Dimensional Config

expression.description:
The expression is the full EXCLUDE constraint definition including "EXCLUDE" keyword.
 Example: "EXCLUDE USING gist (room_id WITH =, during WITH &&)"

name.description: The name of the EXCLUDE constraint.

bytebase.store.GridLevel.schema.strict.j.description: GridLevel defines a grid level for spatial tessellation.
bytebase.store.GridLevel.schema.strict.j.title: Grid Level

bytebase.store.IndexMetadata.schema.stri.description: IndexMetadata is the metadata for indexes.

comment.description: The comment is the comment of an index.

descending.description: The ordered list of descending flags for the index columns.

expressions.description:
The expressions are the ordered columns or expressions of an index.
 This could refer to a column or an expression.

granularity.description: The number of granules in the block. It's a ClickHouse specific field.

is_constraint.description:
It's a PostgreSQL specific field.
 The unique constraint and unique index are not the same thing in PostgreSQL.

key_length.description:
The ordered list of key lengths for the index.
 If the key length is not specified, it is -1.

opclass_defaults.description: True if the operator class is the default. (PostgreSQL specific).

opclass_names.description:
https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/catalog-pg-opclass.html
 Name of the operator class for each column. (PostgreSQL specific).

parent_index_name.description: The index name of the parent index.

parent_index_schema.description: The schema name of the parent index.

primary.description: The primary is whether the index is a primary key index.

type.description: The type is the type of an index.

unique.description: The unique is whether the index is unique.

visible.description: The visible is whether the index is visible.

bytebase.store.IndexMetadata.schema.stri.title: Index Metadata

bytebase.store.SpatialIndexConfig.schema.description: SpatialIndexConfig is the configuration for spatial indexes across different database engines.

engine_specific.description: Database-specific parameters (stored as key-value pairs for extensibility)

bytebase.store.SpatialIndexConfig.schema.title: Spatial Index Config

bytebase.store.StorageConfig.schema.stri.description: StorageConfig defines storage and performance parameters for spatial indexes.
bytebase.store.StorageConfig.schema.stri.title: Storage Config

bytebase.store.TablePartitionMetadata.sc.description: TablePartitionMetadata is the metadata for table partitions.

expression.description:
The expression is the expression of a table partition.
 For PostgreSQL, the expression is the text of {FOR VALUES
 partition_bound_spec}, see
 https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/sql-createtable.html. For MySQL,
 the expression is the `expr` or `column_list` of the following syntax.
 PARTITION BY
    { [LINEAR] HASH(expr)
    | [LINEAR] KEY [ALGORITHM={1 | 2}] (column_list)
    | RANGE{(expr) | COLUMNS(column_list)}
    | LIST{(expr) | COLUMNS(column_list)} }.

name.description: The name of the table partition.

subpartitions.description: The subpartitions is the list of subpartitions in a table partition.

type.description: The type of a table partition.
type.title: Type

use_default.description:
The use_default is whether the users use the default partition, it stores
 the different value for different database engines. For MySQL, it's [INT]
 type, 0 means not use default partition, otherwise, it's equals to number
 in syntax [SUB]PARTITION {number}.

value.description:
The value is the value of a table partition.
 For MySQL, the value is for RANGE and LIST partition types,
 - For a RANGE partition, it contains the value set in the partition's
 VALUES LESS THAN clause, which can be either an integer or MAXVALUE.
 - For a LIST partition, this column contains the values defined in the
 partition's VALUES IN clause, which is a list of comma-separated integer
 values.
 - For others, it's an empty string.

bytebase.store.TablePartitionMetadata.sc.title: Table Partition Metadata

bytebase.store.TessellationConfig.schema.description: TessellationConfig defines tessellation parameters for spatial indexes.

bounding_box.description: Bounding box for GEOMETRY indexes (SQL Server)

scheme.description:
Tessellation scheme
 Examples: GEOMETRY_GRID, GEOGRAPHY_GRID, GEOMETRY_AUTO_GRID, GEOGRAPHY_AUTO_GRID

bytebase.store.TessellationConfig.schema.title: Tessellation Config
